result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavia Nichole Hill

defendant.name: Hill, Tavia Nichole

records.addlTxt: Hearing on no contact order on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Asst. District Attorney Eric Enli appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court. Defendant does not appear. Court orders bench warrant stayed utnil 10/21/22 at 12:00 p.m.
10:42 a.m. - Case recalled. Defendant now appears in court. Present bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Golden House papers - Voluntary Request to Modify and/or remove a no contact release condition. 
10/14/2022, sent to Sally, Br 8 for review

Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Tavia Nichole Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court.  Attorney James Schoenecker in court for Tavia Nichole Hill. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill appears with attorney Samuel J. Sarver via Zoom.  Present bond continued  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Asst. District Attorney Jonathan Gigot appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court with attorney Samuel J. Sarver. Defendant pleads not guilty to both counts.  Present bond continued  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court with attorney Samuel J. Sarver.  Assistant District Attorney J. Foss Davis appears on behalf of the State.
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Offer Memo 2/28/22
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety. Defendant to have no contact with J.K. or their residence or place of employment.

Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in court with attorney Samuel J. Sarver.  Defendant Tavia Nichole Hill in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Aaron Linssen appears on behalf of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
